H0.text: Wings are the feature commonly associated with birds that the bird ancestor that lived in trees developed.

H1.text: Tails are the feature commonly associated with birds that the bird ancestor that lived in trees developed.

H2.text: Webbed feet are the feature commonly associated with birds that the bird ancestor that lived in trees developed.

H3.text: Beaks are the feature that the bird ancestor that lived in trees developed, a feature commonly associated with birds.

A4.text: Archaeopteryx was a semi‑arboreal climbing animal, following the idea that birds evolved from tree‑dwelling gliders

A5.text: Specimens of Archaeopteryx were most notable for their well‑developed flight feathers
